ability_1.description: The air temperature around Rylai drops rapidly, chilling all around her to the core.
technical_details: Grants a 6-second 900-radius flying vision centered around the area-targeted location upon cast
Reapplying the debuff refreshes the duration, but neither updates the movement speed nor the attack speed slow values
interaction_notes: The Crystal Clone is vulnerable to all Crystal Nova sources

ability_2.name: Frostbite
ability_2.details: Encases an enemy unit in ice, prohibiting movement and attack, while dealing damage over time.
ability_2.description: Rylai channels winds from the Blueheart Glacier, imprisoning attackers in thick blocks of ice.
technical_details: All ability effects are applied immediately despite the visual effects, and cannot be disjointed
Applies Root, Disarm, and True Sight over the affected target
Deals 25 magical spell damage to the affected enemy unit 0.25-second intervals over the entire duration
All of Frostbite's ability effects are more effective on creeps with a 4x damage factor
interaction_notes: The True Sight component affects debuff immune units

ability_3.name: Arcane Aura
ability_3.details: Grants additional mana regeneration to allied units on the map. Grants a greater bonus to allied units closer to the Maiden.
ability_3.description: Cold temperatures promote the essence of magic, causing Rylai's presence to allow spell usage in abundance.
technical_details: Grants Global aura and proximity aura with 1200 radius
Base mana regen bonus: 0.4/0.6/0.8/1 with 3x proximity bonus factor
The duration of Arcane Overflow is paused during Freezing Field
Arcane Overflow cannot be cast during Freezing Field upgraded with Aghanim's Scepter

ability_4.name: Crystal Clone
ability_4.details: Creates a Crystal Clone of Rylai in her place while sliding to the area-targeted direction and disjointing incoming projectiles.
ability_4.description: So convincing that some allies have spent minutes talking to the clone before they realized she wasn't speaking back.
technical_details: Acquiring Aghanim's Shard unlocks this ability
Does not interrupt Rylai's channeling abilities upon cast
The created illusion is uncontrollable and untargetable
interaction_notes: If the Crystal Clone takes enough damage or times out, it shatters, and applies Frostbite of its corresponding level to enemies within the radius

ability_5.name: Freezing Field
ability_5.details: Surrounds Crystal Maiden with random icy explosions that slow enemies and deal massive damage.
ability_5.description: Once the place of her exile, Icewrack has become an anchor for Rylai's frigid onslaught.
technical_details: Move Speed Slow: 40%, Attack Speed Slow: 80/120/160
With Scepter: Explosion Spawn Factor 1.2x, removes channeling restriction
interaction_notes: The Crystal Clone is vulnerable to all Freezing Field sources
Both the movement speed slow and attack speed slow component applied within the radius are independent of the icy explosions

changes: Arcane Aura Arcane Overflow: No longer interrupts movement orders
Reduced allied ability cast mana replenishement factor from 0.25 to 0.15
Now self-mana restores for 0.15 * AlliedAbilityCast ManaCost per proc while active
Blueheart Floe: REMOVED the Cold Comfort facet
Rescaled self-mana regeneration amplification from 50% on each level to 25%/50%/75%/100%
This component levels up with Freezing Field
Crystal Nova: Reduced slow duration from 5 to 4
ADDED new Glacial Guard facet
Arcane Aura: ADDED new Arcane Overflow facet
REMOVED the Freezing Field Frozen Expanse facet
Talents: LVL 10 +100 Crystal Nova radius → +12 intelligence
Increased agility gain from 1.6 to 1.8
Talents: LVL 15 -4s Crystal Nova cooldown increased to -4.5s

Aeon Disk.name: Aeon Disk
Aeon Disk.description: A powerful artifact long ago smuggled out of the Ivory Incubarium. Or so many believe.

abilities.name: Combo Breaker
abilities.description: When the wielder's health is below the threshold and they take player-based damage, applies a strong dispel and a buff on the wielder, that provides status resistance and negates all damage the wielder takes, but also negates any damage they deal while active.
notes: Only triggers on player-based damage, including damage from allies and own units
Triggers upon taking damage greater than 0 (before reductions)
Does not trigger on self-inflicted damage, damage flagged as HP Removal, or on instant kill effects
The triggering damage instance is fully negated as well
Also triggers on damage that would drop the wielder below the threshold
The ability cooldown increases per trigger and is bound to the wielder
Rebuying the item does not reset the ability cooldown
Stacks additively with other sources of generic incoming damage manipulation
Stacks multiplicatively with all other sources of outgoing damage reduction
Combo Breaker first applies the strong dispel, then the buff
Stacks multiplicatively with other sources of status resistance

additionalInfo: Aeon Disk can be a good choice for tanks, initiators/counter-initiators or supports who have strong defensive abilities
Effective against heroes that rely on ambush and/or disables followed up by quick, sudden bursts of damage
Consider purchasing a Blink Dagger or other mobility items with Aeon Disk for quick escape
Summoned units are not affected by the outgoing damage negation by Combo Breaker
Other protective items like Linken's Sphere or Black King Bar can help delay Combo Breaker's activation
The item can save a split pusher from getting killed while being far from his team
Might not be effective against disables that can't be dispelled like Black Hole, Chronosphere, Static Storm, Doom
Can be dispelled by Nullifier which makes it less effective in the late game
Techies mines deal full damage while they are under the effect of Combo Breaker

Aether Lens.name: Aether Lens
Aether Lens.description: Polished with the incantation of his final breath, the gift of a dying mage to his sickly son.

abilities.name: Aethereal Focus
abilities.description: Increases the wielder's cast range for all targeted abilities and items.
notes: Stacks with other cast range increasing items or with ability specific talents
Does not stack with the cast range bonus of other Aether Lenses
Only affects ability cast range
Does not increase the ability's radius or area of effect
Does not increase the cast range of active attack modifiers

additionalInfo: Aether Lens increases the effect range differently per ability
For abilities using projectile or travel speed to a certain distance, the travel speed remains the same while the distance increases unless stated
Certain abilities do not have their effect range increased, despite their cast range being increased
Abilities with Global cast range have their max distance increased instead
All vector targeted abilities have their cast range increased but not their effect range

Aghanim's Scepter.name: Aghanim's Scepter
Aghanim's Scepter.description: The scepter of a wizard with demigod-like powers.

abilities.name: Ability Upgrade
abilities.description: Upgrades an existing ability or grants a new ability, unique to each hero.
notes: Grants each hero one or multiple unique enhancements, ranging from ability upgrades, to hero changes, and sometimes even new abilities
Aghanim's Scepter status of allies can be seen in the scoreboard at all times
Enemies' status can be seen as well, but it only updates once gaining vision over them
Illusions copy the modifier on their creation. The upgrades fully work for them
Most upgrades work normally for the player that drafted the abilities in Ability Draft
Reflected abilities are upgraded based on the original caster's upgrades

additionalInfo: The item's attributes grant the following additional stats:
220 health and 1 health regeneration
120 mana, 0.5 mana regeneration and 1% flat base magic resistance
10 attack speed and 1.67 main armor
10 main attack damage to all Strength/Agility/Intelligence heroes
13.5 main attack damage to universal heroes
Upgrading the item into Aghanim's Blessing automatically consumes the item, converting it into a permanent buff
As a permanent buff, it provides the ability upgrades like the item, but does not provide attributes, health, or mana
The total gold cost for each level is 4200/5800
Aghanim's Blessing is also a Kill Reward item guaranteed to drop on Roshan's third death and onward, when killed on the Dire side
Has a dedicated interface element within the HUD, along with Aghanim's Shard. The symbol lights up once Aghanim's Scepter is acquired
A tooltip pops up when pointing the mouse on this HUD element, showing the hero's ability upgrades

Aghanim's Shard.name: Aghanim's Shard
Aghanim's Shard.description: With origins known only to a single wizard, fragments of this impossible crystal are nearly as coveted as the renowned scepter itself.

abilities.name: Ability Upgrade
abilities.description: Upgrades an existing ability or grants a new ability, unique to each hero. A hero can acquire the ability upgrade buff only once per match.
notes: Once the item enters the hero's inventory or backpack, it gets automatically consumed and converted into a permanent buff
This only happens once. If the hero already has the buff, the item does not get consumed
When consumed, the item is still counted towards the player's networth
Illusions copy the modifier on their creation. The upgrades fully work for them
Most upgrades work normally for the player that drafted the abilities in Ability Draft
Reflected abilities are upgraded based on the original caster's upgrades

additionalInfo: Cannot be purchased by heroes that already have the modifier_item_aghanims_shard modifier
However, it can still be purchased via the hero's courier
Aghanim's Shard status of allies can be seen in the scoreboard at all times
Enemies' status can be seen as well, but it only updates once gaining vision over them
Grants each hero one or multiple unique enhancements, ranging from ability upgrades, to hero changes, and sometimes even new abilities
Has a dedicated interface element within the HUD, along with Aghanim's Scepter
trivia: Aghanim's Shard first made its debut in Aghanim's Labyrinth, where they served as upgrades rewarded at the end of each room
Aghanim's Shard is named after Agahnim, one of the main villains in The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past

recentChanges.description: Aghanim's Shard - Consumable is now granted as a kill reward by Tormentors, and no longer by Roshan. REWORKED Ability Upgrade for multiple heroes including Ancient Apparition, Bounty Hunter, Brewmaster, Clinkz, Disruptor, Drow Ranger, Earth Spirit, Invoker, Magnus, Meepo, Morphling, Omniknight, Oracle, Phantom Lancer, Riki, Spectre, Techies, Undying, Warlock, Zeus

REWORKED Ability Upgrade for multiple heroes including Bounty Hunter, Broodmother, Dark Seer, Enchantress, Enigma, Hoodwink, Luna, Monkey King, Morphling, Nature's Prophet, Razor, Silencer, Skywrath Mage, Snapfire, Spirit Breaker, Tidehunter, Venomancer, Void Spirit, Weaver

Reduced availability time from 1200 to 900. REWORKED Ability Upgrade for multiple heroes including Abaddon, Batrider, Disruptor, Io, Legion Commander, Lina, Mirana, Omniknight, Puck, Pugna, Sven, Tinker, Vengeful Spirit, Zeus

Arcane Boots.name: Arcane Boots
Arcane Boots.description: Magi equipped with these boots are valued in battle.

abilities.name: Replenish
abilities.description: Replenishes mana to nearby allies on cast.
notes: Interrupts the caster's channeling abilities upon cast
Affects every allied unit, including illusions, invulnerable units and hidden units, excluding wards and buildings
Using Replenish every time it is off cooldown is equivalent to having 2.727 mana regeneration bonus per second
Cannot be cast by Meepo clones

abilities.name: Basilius Aura
abilities.description: Increases the mana regeneration of nearby allies.
notes: Can regenerate up to 60 mana in one minute
Does not affect invulnerable units
Multiple identical instances of Basilius Aura do not stack, regardless of source. Stacks with upgraded versions of the aura

additionalInfo: This item is shown as a Team Item in the shop window when purchased by an ally
Movement speed bonuses from multiple pairs of Boots of Speed-based items do not stack
Stacks with all other movement speed bonus
trivia: Arcane Boots was originally created as Arcane Ring, being built out of Ring of Protection, Energy Booster, and a recipe. Its recipe got changed and its theme reworked into Arcane Boots in the 6.68 gameplay patch
Arcane Ring's appearance is designed after this as well, sharing aesthetics with Arcane Boots

recentChanges.description: RENAMED Replenish Mana to just "Replenish"
Increased Recipe cost from 375 to 475 (total cost increases from 1300 to 1400). Reduced mana regeneration bonus from 0.5 to 0.25. Reduced Replenish Mana mana restore from 175 to 150
Reduced mana regeneration bonus from 0.75 to 0.5

Assault Cuirass.name: Assault Cuirass
Assault Cuirass.description: Forged in the depths of the nether reaches, this hellish mail provides an army with increased armor and attack speed.

abilities.name: Assault Aura
abilities.description: Increases the armor and attack speed of nearby allied units and buildings. Also reduces the armor of nearby enemy units and buildings.
notes: Multiple instances of Assault Aura do not stack
Fully stacks with other sources of Buckler-based items' armor aura
A unit can be affected by the positive and the negative aura from different sources at the same time
Affects invulnerable allies and enemies, but not hidden ones
The status debuff icon on enemies only shows up when the affected unit has vision over the source
However, the armor reduction in the HUD is always visible
Now pierces Debuff Immunity

additionalInfo: This item is shown as a Team Item in the shop window when purchased by an ally
With the Assault Aura, the item grants a total of 15 armor and 60 attack speed to the wielder
The Assault Aura is a great tool for pushing enemy towers, as it provides reliable attack speed and armor
The Attack Speed aura works on illusions, but the armor aura does not
The aura is also good for controlled units especially with low base attack time and for the bonus armor and armor reduction of the enemy
Can only be completed with items from the Secret Shop
Cannot be disassembled

Band of Elvenskin.name: Band of Elvenskin
Band of Elvenskin.description: A tensile fabric often used for its light weight and ease of movement.
additionalInfo: The item's attributes grant the following additional stats:
6 attack speed and 1 main armor
6 main attack damage to agility heroes
2.7 main attack damage to universal heroes
trivia: This item is based on the Boots of Quel'Thalas from Warcraft 3
In DotA, the item is named Boots of Elvenskin, which was the original name of the Warcraft 3 item as well
During early beta, this item was named Boots of Elvenskin in Dota 2 as well, along with an icon depicting green boots
However, this was likely changed, to avoid confusion with other boot items, as Band of Elvenskin does not grant movement speed

recentChanges.description: Now builds into Orb of Corrosion
No longer builds into Dragon Lance
No longer builds into Dagon

Belt of Strength.name: Belt of Strength

Black King Bar.name: Black King Bar
Black King Bar.description: A powerful staff imbued with the strength of giants.

abilities.name: Avatar
abilities.description: Grants bonus magic resistance, debuff immunity, and applies a basic dispel upon cast. The wielder has pure damage immunity, including from damage reflect sources for the entire duration.
notes: The ability duration reduces per cast and is bound to the wielder. Rebuying the item does not reset the ability duration.
Interrupts the wielder's channeling abilities upon cast.
Stacks multiplicatively with other magic resistance sources.
A countdown on the item's icon indicates the remaining duration, visible to everyone.
Avatar increases the total magic resistance by 0.4% per 10 intelligence points.
Does not affect collision size despite model size increase.

additionalInfo: This item is shown as a Team Item in the shop window when purchased by an ally.
The item's attributes grant 220 health and 1 health regeneration.
Grants 10 main attack damage to strength heroes.
Grants 4.5 main attack damage to universal heroes.

Blade Mail.name: Blade Mail
Blade Mail.description: A razor-sharp coat of mail, it is the choice of selfless martyrs in combat.

abilities.name: Damage Return (Passive)
abilities.description: Any attack targeted at the wielder harms the attacker for a fixed amount, plus a percentage of the attack damage dealt.
notes: Only reacts on attack damage. Other sources of damage are ignored.
Returns incoming damage before all manipulations. However, damage manipulation on the enemy still affects the damage normally.
Reflected physical damage is affected by damage block as well.
The returned damage is always dealt right after the incoming damage.
Returned damage has the no-reflection flag, preventing its damage from interacting with other sources of damage with the same flag.
The damage has the no-spell-lifesteal flag, preventing its damage from utilising spell lifesteal.
The damage has the no-spell-amplification flag, preventing its damage from being amplified with spell damage amplification.
Returns damage back to the source. This means damage done by summons is reflected back to the summons, not to their owner.
Damage Return has a global range and affects units through the Fog of War or invisibility.
Does not work against wards, buildings and allied units.

abilities.name: Damage Return
abilities.description: For the next few seconds, a portion of all damage taken is reflected back to the source. Does not protect the wielder from the damage.

effects.passiveIncrease: 105% of attack damage taken plus flat value

notes: Does not interrupts the caster's channeling abilities upon cast.
Increases the passive value to 105% of attack damage taken, plus the flat value.
Additionally causes Blade Mail to reflect Spell Damage as well, returning 85% of the damage taken.
Does not reflect self-inflicted damage, damage flagged as HP Removal, or damage with the No-Reflection flag.
Returns the same damage type as received.
Multiple instances of Damage Return from Blade Mails do not stack.

additionalInfo: Multiple instances of Damage Return from Blade Mails do not stack.
Fully stack with other no-reflection damage sources.

Blade of Alacrity.name: Blade of Alacrity
Blade of Alacrity.description: A long blade imbued with time magic.
additionalInfo: The item's attributes grant the following additional stats:
10 attack speed and 1.67 main armor
10 main attack damage to agility heroes

Now builds into Mage Slayer

Blades of Attack.name: Blades of Attack
Blades of Attack.description: The damage of these small, concealable blades should not be underestimated.
trivia: This item is based on the Claws of Attack from Warcraft 3.

recentChanges.description: Now builds into Falcon Blade.
Now builds into Vladmir's Offering.

Blink Dagger.name: Blink Dagger
Blink Dagger.description: The fabled dagger used by the fastest assassin ever to walk the lands.

abilities.name: Blink
abilities.description: Instantly teleports the wielder towards the targeted point.
notes: Blink utilizes the teleport mechanic
When targeting a point within 1200 distance, teleports directly onto the targeted point
When targeting a point beyond 1200 distance, teleports 1200 distance towards the targeted point instead
Incoming projectiles are disjointed upon teleporting
Taking more than 0 damage from any other player or Roshan (after reductions and not flagged as HP Removal) puts the item on a fixed cooldown
Cannot be reset with cooldown reset sources
Doubletap targets a point in front of the team's Fountain
Shares cooldown with other blink items

additionalInfo: Taking damage puts the item on a 3-second mute duration
The item mute component has precedence over all damage manipulation sources
trivia: This item is based on Kelen's Dagger of Escape from Warcraft 3
In DotA, the item was originally named Kelen's Dagger of Escape. Kelen is a rogue from World of Warcraft
Later on, it was shortened to just Kelen's Dagger, because most plays used it aggressively, rather than to escape
In Dota 2, it was renamed to Blink Dagger, to avoid copyright issues with Blizzard Entertainment
Riki and Lion are the only heroes who are missing responses for acquiring a Blink Dagger
Axe's cosmetic item, Little Blink Dagger, is based on Blink Dagger

recentChanges.description: Blink no longer clamps its distance to 4/5 of max distance when targeted beyond the max distance
The item mute component now has precedence over all damage manipulation sources
CHANGED Blink from applying a 3-second damage downtime to a 3-second item mute duration

Blood Grenade.name: Blood Grenade

abilities.name: Throw Grenade
abilities.description: Throws a grenade at an area-targeted location that damages upon impact. Additionally applies a movement speed slow and damage per second debuff on all affected enemy units.
notes: Deals magical spell damage in 1-second intervals, starting 1 second after debuff application upon projectile impact, over 5 instances
Reapplying the debuff refreshes the duration, but does not change the damage intervals
The current health cost utilizes setting health and is non-lethal
Can be cast when the wielder has less than the required current health
Sticky Napalm no longer amplifies the damage of Throw Grenade

additionalInfo: Stock: 1 INIT / 2 MAX

Affects Enemy Units
Damage type: Spell / Magical

recentChanges.description: Reduced gold cost from 65 to 50. Reduced inventory stack count from 3 to 2. Reduced stock count from 3 to 2. Increased stock cooldown from 120 to 180.

notes: Interrupts the caster's channeling abilities upon cast

notes: Briefly turns allies immune to slows as well

Boots of Travel.name: Boots of Travel

abilities.name: Upgrade: Town Portal Scroll
abilities.description: Passively upgrades Town Portal Scroll. Prevents them from being consumed when used, sets the channel time to a fixed value that does not increase with subsequent teleports, and lowers the cooldown. Additionally, allows targeting and directly teleporting to any allied non-hero unit.
notes: Refunds all Town Portal Scrolls the hero currently has equipped, using the regular sellback value
Grants the hero a new Town Portal Scroll for free
Further upgrades reduce channel time and allow targeting allied heroes
The refunding triggers when Boots of Travel enters the hero's main inventory for the first time
Does not trigger when in the backpack, the stash, or in the Courier's inventory

additionalInfo: Upgrading the item improves the passive Teleport Upgrade. Can be upgraded only once.

Movement speed bonuses from multiple pairs of Boots of Speed-based items do not stack, the one with a higher value takes priority.

Alt shows your allied heroes' teleport status and cooldowns under their portraits below the top bar of the HUD.
trivia: Boots of Travels is useful on all heroes during the late game, where it is needed to make desperate pushes or defenses
Consider using Glyph of Fortification to prevent creeps from dying so Boots of Travel can complete channeling of Teleport
Heroes with high split pushing potential should always consider Boots of Travel

Bottle.name: Bottle
Bottle.description: An old bottle that survived the ages, the contents placed inside become enchanted.

abilities.name: Regenerate
abilities.description: Restores health and replenishes mana for a while, by increasing health and mana regeneration.
notes: Interrupts the wielder's channeling abilities upon cast
The ability always self-casts upon cast
Ctrl enables casting Regenerate on an allied hero
Taking more than 0 damage from any other player dispels the buff
Taking more than 0 damage from Roshan dispels the buff
Restores all charges while within the Fountain area
Restores all charges when respawning on the Ofrenda
Power Runes fully replenishes the Bottle as well
Bottles do not restore charges while in the Fountain area when carried by a Courier

abilities.name: Store Rune
abilities.description: The item can store a Rune to be used later, or can be passively activated after a set duration. Activating the Rune restores all Bottle charges.
notes: Right-click on a Rune now stores it within the Bottle
Attempting to store another Rune activates the current Rune instead
When the Bottle has a Rune, Regenerate activates the rune, restores the Bottle's charges
Passively activated upon reaching its max store rune duration
Couriers can neither activate nor store runes
This ability is not affected by mute sources

additionalInfo: Bottle containing a rune cannot be shared, dropped, or moved into the backpack
Bottle is a permanent item, using up all charges does not make it disappear
The sell value of the item does not depend on the remaining charges, nor on the stored rune
The Tempest Double does not copy this item, despite not being a consumable
recommendedHeroes: Heroes who play in the mid-lane usually do well with a Bottle, because it allows them to control runes

states.contains: Fountain Water with varying charge levels

trivia: Prior to the February 01, 2018 Patch, Bottle's passive ability, Store Rune, did not have an official name. The name was taken from the Dota 2 Wiki and officially implemented into Dota 2.
In DotA, this item is called Magical Bottle. The reason for why it was changed to Bottle in Dota 2 is unknown.

abilities.name: Magical Damage Block
abilities.description: Consumes a charge to block a fixed portion magical damage from damage instances over a certain value.
notes: Infused Raindrops has the highest priority in the group of damage negating abilities, blocking damage before any of them do

Has a lower priority than Mana Shield, meaning Mana Shield first reduces damage before Infused Raindrop blocks it

Does not stack with other magical damage barriers
If multiple sources of barriers are active on a unit, all of them lose capacity from the same absorbed damage instance
However, if a damage instance is greater than the capacity of all barriers individually, the damage gets blocked as if the barriers were one barrier with combined capacity
Neither consumes charges nor blocks any damage while on cooldown

additionalInfo: When having multiple Infused Raindrops, all of them lose charges simultaneously, but only one of them blocks the damage

abilities.name: Soul Release
abilities.description: When cast on an ally, consumes a charge to grant the target allied hero bonus health regeneration for a while. When cast on an enemy, consumes a charge to deal damage over time to the target, based on their current health, as well as reduce the effectiveness of healing and health restoration the target receives.
notes: Taking more than 0 damage from any other player (after reductions and not flagged as HP Removal) dispels the buff
Taking more than 0 damage from Roshan (after reductions) dispels the buff
Has no recharge time. Cooldown resetting effects do not restore charges
Gains charges whenever an enemy hero dies within range. Gains more charges when at 0 charges
Also gains charges when the wielder dies while at 0 charges
All current charges on Urn of Shadows are carried over when upgraded to a Spirit Vessel
Double-tapping automatically targets self
Does not interrupt the wielder's channeling abilities
Can only be cast on heroes, including illusions and creep-heroes
Successive casts on the same target do not stack but refresh the duration instead
Spirit Vessel's modifiers override the modifiers of Urn of Shadows

additionalInfo: This item is shown as a Team Item in the shop window when purchased by an ally
If an Urn of Shadows was purchased as well, Spirit Vessel's icon takes priority
The item's attributes grant 220 health and 1 health regeneration
The item's attributes grant 120 mana, 0.5 mana regeneration and 1% flat base magic resistance
The item's attributes grant 10 attack speed and 1.67 main armor
The item's attributes grant 10 main attack damage to all Strength/Agility/Intelligence heroes
The item's attributes grant 13.5 main attack damage to universal heroes
Can regenerate up to 320 health on target allies

Staff of Wizardry.name: Staff of Wizardry
Staff of Wizardry.description: A staff of magical powers passed down from the eldest mages.
additionalInfo: The item's attributes grant the following additional stats:
120 mana, 0.5 mana regeneration and 1% flat base magic resistance.
10 main attack damage to intelligence heroes.
4.5 main attack damage to universal heroes.

recentChanges.description: No longer builds into Dagon. Now builds into Orchid Malevolence
Now builds into Dagon.
No longer builds into the following items: Dagon, Meteor Hammer

Tango.name: Tango
Tango.description: Forage to survive on the battlefield.

abilities.name: Devour
abilities.description: Consumes the target tree to gain health regeneration for some time. The tree is destroyed in the process.
notes: Can target allied heroes as well. Doing so gives one Tango charge to them, however, this single Tango expires after a while.
When cast on an Iron Branch tree, or on a tree from Sprout with the Soothing Saplings facet, the health regen duration is greatly increased.
The buff of successive casts do not stack but refresh the duration instead.
Can regenerate up to 112 (224) health over its full duration. All 3 charges can regenerate up to 336 (672) health.
When targeting an allied hero, it grants them a Tango (Shared) in their inventory, instead of granting health regeneration.
If the targeted ally's inventory is full, the item is dropped on the ground.
Treats the Spirit Bear as heroes, and illusions as creeps.
A shared Tango disappears 40 seconds after being created.

additionalInfo: A full set of Tangos is not shareable. However, it is possible to give allies a charge, Tango (Shared), by casting it on them.
trivia: In the original DotA, Tango's full name was "Ancient Tango of Essifation".
Tango's active ability was called "Eat a Tree or Ward" before July 19, 2017 Patch.
Ancient Knowledge Stone may have inspired the creation of Tango.

recentChanges.description: Devour now treats the Sprouted tree as a regular tree.
Devour now cuts the Sprouted tree down and no longer grants health regeneration duration bonus.
Reduced initial stock from Infinite to 4. Reduced max stock from Infinite to 4. Increased restock time from 0 to 120.

Town Portal Scroll.name: Town Portal Scroll

abilities.name: Teleport
abilities.description: Teleports its wielder to the unit-targeted allied building. Increases the teleport channel time when multiple allied heroes simultaneously channels to the same allied building.
notes: Consumes mana, goes into cooldown and does nothing when the channeling is interrupted
Has targeting functionalities for buildings, outposts, and fountain
Channel time increases linearly for most buildings when multiple heroes teleport to the same location
Does not increase channel time when teleporting to Fountain
Grants 1-second 200-radius flying vision at teleport destination during channeling
All ability effects are visible and audible to everyone

abilities.name: Item Properties
abilities.description: All heroes start the game with an unsellable Town Portal Scroll. Grants a charge whenever a hero dies to an enemy or an allied unit.
notes: Does not grant charges from self-denies or kills credited to neutral creeps
Town Portal Scrolls gained from death do not refund gold when sold upon upgrading to Boots of Travel
Heroes have a dedicated Town Portal Scroll slot on the HUD
An unsellable Town Portal Scroll in a stack makes every item in the stack unsellable

additionalInfo: Alt shows your allied heroes' teleport status and cooldowns under their portraits
Teleport status display priorities: Boots of Travel 2 > Boots of Travel > Town Portal Scroll
Teleport status does not show other teleport abilities
trivia: This item is based on the Scroll of Town Portal from Warcraft 3
On August 13, 2018, a green Town Portal Scroll briefly appeared in the main game that worked like Boots of Travel 2 and cost only 50 gold
The description is a reference to the very first Dota 2 Gamescom trailer
Activating a Town Portal Scroll appears to require the casting hero's blood
Using Black King Bar before Town Portal Scroll is sometimes called 'Nightfalling' in the pro scene

recentChanges.description: Upgrade: Town Portal Scroll now also reduces all channel time by 1
Heroes no longer gain a free Town Portal Scroll if they denied themselves

Reduced number of starting Town Portal Scrolls from 3 to 1. Heroes now gain 1 unsellable Town Portal Scroll for free upon dying. Increased gold cost from 90 to 100. Teleport: Increased max distance towards building from 575 to 800. Reduced channel time towards Outposts from 6 to 5

Tranquil Boots.name: Tranquil Boots
Tranquil Boots.description: While they increase the longevity of the wearer, this boot is not particularly reliable.

abilities.name: Break
abilities.description: Whenever the wielder attacks a hero or is attacked by a any unit, the boots' passive health regeneration bonus is lost, and the movement speed bonus is reduced for a while.
notes: Reduces Tranquil Boots' bonuses to 40 movement speed and 0 health regeneration
Only triggers when the wielder's attacks land, or when an attack lands on the wielder
Missed or disjointed attacks do not trigger Break
Also reacts on instant attacks that normally do not trigger on-attack effects
Does not break upon attacking non-hero units. Treats creep-heroes as creeps
The downtime is affected by cooldown reductions. However, although cooldown resetting effects visually reset the cooldown, they do not reset the broken state
Tranquil Boots are always in the broken state for illusions, and permanently appear broken on allied illusions. Do not appear broken on enemy illusions, until they attack or are attacked

additionalInfo: Movement speed bonuses from multiple pairs of Boots of Speed-based items do not stack
Stacks with all other movement speed bonus
The health regeneration of multiple Tranquil Boots-based items fully stacks

recentChanges.description: Reduced Wind Lace cost from 250 to 225 (total cost decreases from 925 to 900)
Now builds into Boots of Bearing
Reduced movement speed bonus from 70 to 65

abilities.description: When cast on an ally, consumes a charge to grant the target allied hero bonus health regeneration for a while. When cast on an enemy, consumes a charge to deal damage over time to the target for a while.
notes: Taking more than 0 damage from any other player (after reductions and not flagged as HP Removal) dispels the healing buff
Taking more than 0 damage from Roshan (after reductions) dispels the healing buff
Has no recharge time. Cooldown resetting effects do not restore charges
Gains charges whenever an enemy hero dies within range. Gains more charges when at 0 charges
Also gains charges when the wielder dies while at 0 charges
When upgraded to Spirit Vessel, all the current charges are carried over
Double-tapping automatically targets self
Does not interrupt the wielder's channeling abilities
Can only be cast on heroes, including illusions and creep-heroes
Does not gain charges from Illusions, Clones, or Creep-Heroes
Does not gain a charge if the enemy hero has Reincarnation
Has to be within the main inventory to gain charges
Successive casts on the same target do not stack but refresh the duration instead
Urn of Shadows' modifiers get both overridden by Spirit Vessel's modifiers

additionalInfo: This item is shown as a Team Item in the shop window when purchased by an ally
If a Spirit Vessel was purchased as well, Spirit Vessel's icon takes priority
The item's attributes grant 44 health and 0.2 health regeneration
Grants 24 mana, 0.1 mana regeneration and 0.2% flat base magic resistance
Provides 2 attack speed and 0.33 main armor
Adds 2 main attack damage to all Strength/Agility/Intelligence heroes
Adds 2.7 main attack damage to universal heroes
Can regenerate up to 240 health on target allies
Can deal up to 200 damage to target enemies (before reductions)

recentChanges.description: REWORKED recipe and stats. Recipe changed from Sage's Mask + Ring of Protection + Fluffy Hat + Recipe (880 gold total) to Sage's Mask + Ring of Protection + Circlet + Recipe (825 gold total). Stats changed from +125 Health, +1.4 Mana Regeneration, +2 Armor to +2 Strength, +2 Agility, +2 Intelligence, +1.4 Mana Regeneration, +2 Armor.

REWORKED recipe and stats. Recipe changed from Sage's Mask + Ring of Protection + Circlet + Recipe (880 gold total) to Sage's Mask + Ring of Protection + Fluffy Hat + Recipe (880 gold total). Stats changed from +2 Strength, +2 Agility, +2 Intelligence, +1.4 Mana Regeneration, +2 Armor to +125 Health, +1.4 Mana Regeneration, +2 Armor. Soul Release cooldown increased from 7s to 10s.
Clone sources no longer gain Soul Release charges.

Vanguard.name: Vanguard
Vanguard.description: A powerful shield that defends its wielder from even the most vicious of attacks.

abilities.name: Damage Block
abilities.description: Grants the wielder a chance to block a fixed portion of physical attack damage.
notes: Uses pseudo-random distribution
When multiple different sources proc on the same attack, the one with a higher value takes priority
Multiple sources of the same value stack multiplicatively
Does not work against damage from wards sources
Does not reduce physical damage from abilities, except for specific abilities

additionalInfo: The proc chances of all sources of Damage Block work independently from each other
When multiple sources of Damage Block proc on the same attack, only the one with the highest blocked damage value takes effect
Can be disassembled
Effective to block the attack damage from summoned units and illusions
Especially useful with tanky frontline heroes
Less useful for heroes with high armor
Can be purchased over a lifesteal item to jungle with a melee hero
Often disassembled into Heart of Tarrasque or Lotus Orb in late game

Veil of Discord.name: Veil of Discord

abilities.name: Magic Weakness
abilities.description: Weakens nearby enemies by applying a debuff that amplifies any spell damage they take.
notes: Does not interrupt the caster's channeling abilities upon cast
Applies generic incoming damage amplification on affected enemy units
Only affects spell damage of all damage types, does not affect attack damage
Does not affect damage flagged as HP Removal
Stacks additively with other sources of generic incoming damage manipulation
Affects invulnerable units as well
Shares a debuff with Arctic Blast, the last applied source overrides previous sources

additionalInfo: The item's attributes grant the following additional stats:
88 health and 0.4 health regeneration
48 mana, 0.2 mana regeneration and 0.4% flat base magic resistance
4 attack speed and 0.67 main armor
4 main attack damage to all Strength/Agility/Intelligence heroes
5.4 main attack damage to universal heroes

Vladmir's Offering.name: Vladmir's Offering
Vladmir's Offering.description: An eerie mask that is haunted with the malice of a fallen vampire.

abilities.name: Vladmir's Aura
abilities.description: Increases the attack damage, mana regen, and armor of nearby allies, and grants them lifesteal.
notes: Multiple instances of Vladmir's Aura do not stack
Fully stacks with other sources of Buckler-based items' armor aura and Ring of Basilius-based items' mana regeneration aura
Only works with physical attack damage, does not work with magical or pure attack damage
Does not work with physical or any other spell damage
Does not work with instant attacks that do not trigger attack modifier
Stacks additively with other lifesteal sources
Treats illusions and creep-heroes as heroes
Does not work on allied units, buildings, couriers, or ward-type units
Lifesteal is less effective when attacking creeps
Grants flat bonus attack damage based on the affected unit's main attack damage
Can regenerate up to 60 mana in one minute
Affects invulnerable, but not hidden units

additionalInfo: This item is shown as a Team Item in the shop window when purchased by an ally
All of the bonuses from Vladmir's Offering is provided by Vladmir's Aura
Can be disassembled

Void Stone.name: Void Stone
Void Stone.description: Jewelry that was once used to channel nether realm magic, this ring pulses with energy.

recentChanges.description: MOVED from Secret Shops to Base Shops under Miscellaneous. No longer builds into Octarine Core and Pavise. Now builds into Echo Sabre.
Now builds into Octarine Core.
Reduced gold cost from 825 to 700. Reduced mana regeneration bonus from 2.25 to 1.75. No longer builds into Orchid Malevolence. Now builds into Pavise.

Voodoo Mask.name: Voodoo Mask
Voodoo Mask.description: A mask tuned to sip the arcane bindings that pass between caster and foe.

abilities.name: Magic Lifesteal
abilities.description: Restores the wielder's health for a portion of damage dealt by magical and physical spell damage.
notes: Only works with magical and physical spell damage
Does not work with attack damage or any pure damage
Does not work with damage with the HP Removal or the no-reflection flags
Stacks additively with other spell lifesteal sources
Treats creep-heroes as heroes
The lifesteal value is reduced by a factor of 0.2 against creeps
Does not work on allied units, illusions, buildings, ward-type units, or couriers

additionalInfo: Multiple instances of spell lifesteal from the same source do not stack
Spell lifesteal from different sources stacks additively

recentChanges.description: Spell Lifesteal bonus against heroes/creeps increased from +10/2% to +12/2.4%
Now builds into Revenant's Brooch
Now builds into Dagon. No longer builds into Eternal Shroud

Wind Lace.name: Wind Lace
Wind Lace.description: Hasten to battle on wind-touched heels.
additionalInfo: Movement speed bonuses from multiple Wind Laces do not stack.
However, Wind Lace stacks with other Wind Lace-based items.
Stacks with all other movement speed bonus.
trivia: The Wind Lace was first suggested on Playdota in 2010 by RCHLNKI.
Wind Lace was inspired by the introduction of Javelin, which became the base for proc based items. Wind Lace aimed to be a base for non-boot movement based items.
Wind Lace was called "Wind Lance" in the beta.

recentChanges.description: Reduced gold cost from 250 to 225. Reduced movement speed bonus from 20 to 15.
No longer builds into Spirit Vessel.
CHANGED movement speed bonus from 6% to a flat 20.

Wind Waker.name: Wind Waker
Wind Waker.description: Proof enough to some that unseen forces manipulate the happenings of the material plane.

abilities.name: Cyclone
abilities.description: Sweeps the target up into a cyclone, applying a basic dispel, turning them invulnerable for a short while.
notes: Double-tapping automatically targets self
Applies a basic dispel and Cyclone effect on the target upon cast, turning it invulnerable and fully disabled
The Cyclone duration is not affected by status resistance
If cast on self, silences, mutes, and disarms the caster, instead of fully disabling them
Cyclone first applies the dispel, then the cyclone modifier
While cycloned, the affected unit is moved upwards and has no collision
A 24-radius pathing blocker is created at the base of the affected unit while active
The damage is applied at the end of the duration and only to enemy targets
If the cyclone gets dispelled, it still applies the damage as soon as the target lands
If the target is an enemy, they also take damage upon landing
If the target is the wielder, they can move freely at a fixed speed, but are still unable to attack or cast abilities or items. Gains free pathing and ignores turn rates
Cannot lift up Roshan, instead, it instantly applies the damage
Shares cooldown with Eul's Scepter of Divinity

additionalInfo: This item is shown as a Team Item in the shop window when purchased by an ally
If a Eul's Scepter of Divinity was purchased as well, Wind Waker's icon takes priority
The item's attributes grant 420 mana, 1.75 mana regeneration and 3.5% flat base magic resistance
35 main attack damage to Intelligence heroes
15.75 main attack damage to universal heroes
Stacks with all other movement speed bonuses
Purges first, then applies Cyclone modifier
Item can only be completed with items from the Secret Shop
Cannot be disassembled

Witch Blade.name: Witch Blade
Witch Blade.description: A spiteful blade inadvertently possessed by the soul of its incautious creator.

abilities.name: Witch Blade
abilities.description: The next attack poisons the target, slowing their movement speed and dealing damage over time, based on the wielder's intelligence. This attack cannot miss.
notes: The effect triggers upon reaching the attack point of an attack, regardless of whether the attack lands or not
For ranged heroes this is upon projectile launch
The attack has True Strike, so it cannot miss
Uses a custom projectile when the wielder is ranged
Reapplying the debuff refreshes the duration
Does not affect Buildings, Ward-type units, or Ally units
The attacks first apply the debuff, then their own attack damage
Checks the wielder's intelligence continuously and updates the damage values immediately
Deals damage in 1-second intervals, starting 1 second after the debuff is applied, resulting in 4 instances
Can deal up to 300% of the wielder's intelligence as damage (before reductions)

additionalInfo: The item's attributes grant the following additional stats:
144 mana, 0.6 mana regeneration and 1.2% flat base magic resistance
12 main attack damage to Intelligence heroes
5.4 main attack damage to Universal heroes
The projectile speed bonus only affects attack projectiles

Wraith Band.name: Wraith Band
Wraith Band.description: A circlet with faint whispers echoing about it.
additionalInfo: The item's attributes grant the following additional stats:
44 health and 0.2 health regeneration
24 mana, 0.1 mana regeneration and 0.2% flat base magic resistance
5 attack speed and 0.83 main armor
2, 5 and 2 main attack damage to all Strength/Agility/Intelligence heroes respectively
4.05 main attack damage to universal heroes

recentChanges.description: No longer doubles its bonuses at 25 minutes.
